etymology.interpretation: Water component points to meanings tied to water and moisture. 朝 supplies the sound cháo and also resonates metaphorically with a flowing ‘tide’ or current, which extends to the sense of a social trend.

examples.chinese: 今晚海上会有大潮(今晚海上會有大潮)。
examples.pinyin: Jīn wǎn hǎi shàng huì yǒu dàcháo.
examples.english: There will be a high tide at sea tonight.

examples.chinese: 南方夏天很潮湿(南方夏天很潮濕)。
examples.english: Summers in the south are very humid.

examples.chinese: 这款衣服很潮(這款衣服很潮)，年轻人都在追这个潮流(年輕人都在追這個潮流)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kuǎn yīfu hěn cháo, niánqīngrén dōu zài zhuī zhège cháoliú.
examples.english: These clothes are very trendy, and young people are all chasing this trend.
